Rivers]] | succeeded=[[Nick Begich]] | birth_date={{birth date|1920|04|11}} | birth_place=[[Chicago]], [[Illinois]] | death_date={{death date and age|2011|01|09|1920|04|11}} | death_place=[[Coronado, California]] | spouse= | children= | religion= | occupation= | residence= | alma_mater= }} '''Howard Wallace Pollock''' (April 11, 1920 – January 9, 2011)<ref>http://newsminer.com/bookmark/10975591-Howard-Pollock-Alaska-s-2nd-congressman-dies-at-90</ref> was an [[United States|American]] politician and [[United States Republican Party|Republican]] Representative from [[Alaska]]. Pollock was born in [[Chicago]] and went to school in [[Perkinston, Mississippi]]. He studied [[law]] at the [[Santa Clara University|University of Santa Clara]] in [[California]] and at the [[University of Houston]], [[Texas]], and then did some postgraduate studies at the [[MIT]], where he got a [[Master of Science|M.S.]] in industrial management. He was a practicing attorney. He enlisted as a seaman in the [[United States Navy]] in 1941 and retired with rank of [[lieutenant commander]] in 1946. Pollock served in the Alaska Territorial Legislature 1953–1955. He later served in the [[Alaska Senate]] 1961–1963 and 1965–1966; and was elected as a Republican to the Ninetieth and Ninety-first [[United States Congress|Congress]]es (January 3, 1967 – January 3, 1971). He was not a candidate for reelection in 1970 to the Ninety-second Congress, but rather was an unsuccessful candidate for Republican nomination for Governor of Alaska. Pollock was also a past president of the [[National Rifle Association]].
